website_summaries.verdict: The Zoom H2 is a fun, practical, and affordable tool for capturing interviews, lectures, and music rehearsals. Cheap construction and lackluster recording performance, however, make the H2 less than ideal for demanding professional recording applications.
pros: The Zoom H2 handheld audio recorder offers an exceptional array of features and resolution support at nearly half the price of its competitors
Its small size makes it one of the least obtrusive pro-audio recorders available
cons: The Zoom H2's plastic construction feels more like a children's toy than a high-end audio recorder
several practical features are difficult to access
the recording performance of the built-in microphones could be better
and the start-up time is unforgivably long

customer_reviews.title: good things come in small packages.
customer_reviews.text: This little device is capable of picking up studio like quality recordings. It is one overall clip, not layered, but when positioned right, it can produce a very nice quality recording. We used this with our band and were able to capture many songs in high quality recordings. You record to an Sd card and then it’s easliy transferable to a computer.
customer_reviews.author: Yelnam

customer_reviews.title: " The quality is pretty good. There's a toggle switch on the side ...
customer_reviews.text: A bit expensive, and I keep messing up the mode from "ready to record" and "actually recording now." The quality is pretty good. There's a toggle switch on the side that allows you to limit loud things from blowing out the quality. But most of the time, you would want it set to record quieter things than concert speakers. Sometimes it picks up too much ambient noise instead of what you expect it to -- more omnidirectional rather than focused. Interesting piece of equipment, but cost me more than I expected. It does have a microphone input, too, so you can attach a lavalier or directional mic, I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: The only thing i can add to the other reviews is..........just buy it. This is the best digital recorder i have owned, and that includes about 8. I've surfed around for quality and price....this Zoom is Military grade qualiy, and it works like it is intented to do. Just be sure to read the instruction book to get to know the device and you will catch on fast. I just recorded a full 2 hour concert from 30 rows back, it WILL accept a 4GB SDHC card and performed in 4 chanel stereo. The playback was exceptional quality. Great for classroom, music just about anything. Just get it, you won't be returning this baby unless it arrives broken.
customer_reviews.author: PWayne

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: Ive own the zoom H2 for quite sometime and stopped using this recorder because of 2 things. Battery life and the display. This consumes lotsa juice and I don't like to be changing batteries all the time. Also the screen display is very small. It does record really well but these two things really stand in my way. I have the Olympus Ls 11 and I'm very satisfied. This is just my opinion and I'm sure people are very happy with the Zoom H2. There's another model the Zoom H2n. I'm planning on getting it cause I do love the surround sound and the H2n has five mikes. When I get it I will write more on that.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small yet Powerful
customer_reviews.text: This small device has amazing quality. The built-in mic records very well compared to those tiny hand-held mono-recorders. Mic gain controls boost volume BUT add some noise (like reviews state) but when used on low-gain, record quite well. Audio-IN records even better when used with good microphones and a mixer (I used a Behringer U-802) for AMAZINGLY clear recordings. Several types of SDHC cards work well and have NOT found a card that did NOT work with this device. Even NiMH (1.2V) batteries can power this, although alkaline (1.5V) last longer. CON: The plastic case is vulnerable to scratches and breakages so treat carefully.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Gammon

customer_reviews.title: love this
customer_reviews.text: man do i love my Zoom H2 recorder! ive owned it for YEARS now, and it has never ever let me down. when i first got it, i was hating a little because it feels really lightweight and kinda plastic-y, but it's never failed. ive recorded hundreds of DJ sets and live performances without fail. still use it all the time. HIGHLY HIGHLY recommended. * UPDATE it's 2019, and I'm STILL using this on tour and on film shoots and it hasn't failed a single time!!! LOVE THIS DEVICE!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Liu

customer_reviews.title: big bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Prior to purchasing this product, I consulted with friends in the professional recording business. Their comments caused me to purchase it, even though I have previously spent thousands of dollars on recording equipment. Although the unit cannot fully compete with equipment costing $50,000 such as is used for producing mass-marketed CDs, it does an amazingly good job compared to items costing several hundreds. Its size makes it admirably flexible for use in locations infeasible for setting up more elaborate equipment. Interfacing it with computers for burning CDs of very high amateur quality is very simple--and saves bundles of time. It is truly a real bargain in cost, quality, and ease of application. Carl H. Berggren, 12-20-2008
customer_reviews.author: Carl Berggren

customer_reviews.title: The Fifth Star Will Be Awarded, Once...
customer_reviews.text: ...this unit will be equipped with auto-shut-off in battery mode. I have gone through many AA batteries, not because of the H2's ferocious drain, but because I happened to forgot to turn it off too many times after being done recording. As there is no obvious reminder that the unit is on (the unit's display goes dark after a few seconds) it would happen way too often that I come back the next day to find the AAs inside completely drained. Aside of that: Five Stars for sound, ease of operation, SPL overload protection, gentle compression when needed, and many other features which make the H2 an intuitive, affordable hifi recording tool.
customer_reviews.author: Junior Marbles

customer_reviews.title: Zoom H2
customer_reviews.text: A must have for the performing musician, especially when making tapes for festivals/auditions. It has a nice compact design and records extremely clearly when used properly. The price is also very fair compared to other units out there with more bells and whistles. Have had the H2 for 3 years and have never had a problem. The SD card it comes with is rather small, so purchase a bigger one (at least 2 gb) so that you will have more hours of space should you need them. The bottom line: If you are looking for something portable, reliable, and records well give this a try. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Peter M. Bianca

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality and User and Musician Friendly
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to use, even if you're not tech savvy. The quality is great. I've used it to record: Audition Cd's Practice sessions Band rehearsals (concert band and church bands) Voice notes Lectures and Sermons Can be Battery Operated, or Plugged in. And you can transfer data onto a computer via USB or removable SD card. Great Investment!
customer_reviews.author: Marge

customer_reviews.title: Great easy to use recorder
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the Zoom H2 recorder based on the reviews I read here. It met all of our expectations, being very easy to use and easy to configure for the way we want to do recordings. They recordings are of high quality. The system's capabilities were put to the test in another way when the power went out during our worship service. The power did come back on in time to record the sermon, but we were prepared to simply place the battery powered record on the pulpit and record without any power. It's size and performance are perfect for our needs. We are very pleased with its capabilities and function.
customer_reviews.author: dwf

customer_reviews.title: No more reel-to-reel, I've gone digital
customer_reviews.text: From recording concerts from which to cut CDs to laying down voice tracks to merge with audio files, this little number does the trick. This replaces my old 20-20000Hz mikes on tripods and reel to reel 7 1/2ips magnetic recording equipment. With proper placement and post production software from another vendor, I am immensely satisfied with the product. The simplicity and portability make recording performances in which I am performing so much less awkward and distracting. A joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Record live music in stereo
customer_reviews.text: Of all the gimmicks that I own, this is one of the best in both its features and its usefulness. Unlike the standard tape or digital voice recorders, this device allows recording live music (wherever it is not prohibited) with CD quality. My wife sings in a choir and I recorded their latest concert; my recording rivals the one done with suspended microphones and several thousand dollars worth of electronics. Loaded with extra features to reformat the music and allowing the recording from external sources, I love this device.
customer_reviews.author: George F. Greenwald

customer_reviews.title: Zoom H2
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a portable recorder, mainly to capture song ideas. I have always had a cassette recorder, and I have computer recording capabilities as well, but I wanted something I could just turn on when a song idea hit me. This little unit works great. I like the recording format and the sound quality is pretty darn good. The only thing I'm a bit iffy on is it feels like it would break rather easily. It has a little weight to it, so it seems like if it fell of the desk it would be ruined. I haven't dropped it, so I can't say for certain. Other than that cool product.
customer_reviews.author: Walter T. Blythsom

customer_reviews.title: Zoom H2 Portable Recorder
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this product for a while now & it has some awesome features. This little Recorder is absolutely amazing for it's size. Takes some practice to appreciate all the features. I recommended this Recorder to a fellow musician friend & he bought one also from Amazon & he loves it & records all his gigs with it now instead of the old huge unit he was using & told me it does a much better job than his old unit. He even used his on a tripod to record a gravesite funeral service that his family can keep for memories of a loved one.
customer_reviews.author: bobby 12333

customer_reviews.title: Great recorder
customer_reviews.text: I got the ZoomH2 so that I could provide practice recordings for people in the choir I work with. I found it easy to use for recording. The recording sound quality is very nice. It is very easy to adjust the gain on the recording. One downside is that you can't pause a recording and then continue, it starts a new file, but I can easily live with that. The other downside is that you have to use the earbuds to listen to a recording. It doesn't have any speakers. Not a big deal for what I'm using it for. It is easy to download the files and then burn to CD. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jen B

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have For All Musicians!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a musician and use the H2 all the time I play or rehearse. This is so east to use and even though the unit is plastic it holds up to a lot. Once recently I had the H2 mounted on a Mic stand to record a band rehearsal. a member of the band accidentally hit the mic stand and threw the H2 across the wood floor about 20 feet. I thought that's it the H2 was toast, but to my surprise it is still working just as it did when it came out of the box. It is a great tool for all musicians in any field. I highly recommend getting the H2.
customer_reviews.author: V. Dias

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping Zoom H2
customer_reviews.text: Great little digital recorder. Priced just right. I received it within a few days of ordering it. The shipping was fast. I play in a small music group and at one practice I recorded us and then made CD's for each of us. The group thought it sounded almost as good a a professional CD. I used it for a meeting the other day and it worked great. There are so many features on this little recorder. I am learning something new every day. Just remember to order a larger SD card. The one that comes with it is not large enough to record more than 45 minutes of voice or music.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Senak

customer_reviews.title: Note on Left/Right channels & avoiding reversal.
customer_reviews.text: As noted in a single page insert in the manual "Note About Left/Right Positioning During Recording". Apparently musicians self-recording with the microphone from where they sit will want the recorder set to "Player" (not "Listener"), in the Menu setting for "L/R Posi". If you are recording a source from the audience, facing the source, you will want the recorder set to "Listener" (not "Player"), otherwise left/right channels will be the reverse of what you want .. Otherwise, in agreement w/ other reviews on quality of recordings, all around quality of machine.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great recorder for a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent recorder for the price. I have also used it as an audio interface to record high-def video, and it does a superb job. I appreciate Zoom's high quality recording and generous features. I am a professional musican and I need high quality recordings, and this unit does that without fail. I have had it for five years now, use it frequently, dropped it,etc., and it works as well as the day I purchased it. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: jazzykitty

customer_reviews.title: Recording power in the palm of your hand
customer_reviews.text: My hand-held recorder needs are rather simple--just capturing my own guitar, and the occasional covert concert boot--but the Zoom H2 handles the job exceedingly well with great versatility and super sound quality. It does far more than I require with more options and settings, but it's good to have the capability. If I had to complain about the H2, it would be about how tiny the operations screen is and how difficult it is to decipher the letters and symbols of the read-out. The more you use it, however, the more natural it becomes.
customer_reviews.author: Chas.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality and very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Sony mini-disc recorder with this recorder. It's much easier to use, with its built-in microphone and SD card for storage. File transfer to a PC is much easier and requires no special software. Recording quality is as good as the Sony, which is to say that it is fabulous for any kind of recording that you are not expecting to bring into a studio and press onto a cd. The buttons are a little small for my big fingers, but that is my only complaint. On the other hand, it is MUCH easier to navigate the menus on this than on the Sony.
customer_reviews.author: GaryBerger

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Could use a higher, more crisp volume, but great product. I'd like to get a few more if they were still available. Hard to find.
customer_reviews.author: Charmsista

customer_reviews.title: Works great, lots of options
customer_reviews.text: Using Zoom H2 with 8GB SanDisk Ultra Class 4 SDHC card. Works great! Audio is great on lowest or highest setting. On lowest setting there is a little hum (I was also filming in a gymnasium, so this is forgiven. PLUS, the mic did not pick up awful gym echos like I thought it would). Works great with Lavalier mic for 1 on 1 recording also. 8GB is 3 hours of recording on highest quality WAV. I am very impressed. Also, I can use the USB mic functionality with Dragon Naturally Speaking 11 to write and control my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Newspeak

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome microphone! I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Zoom H2 for 6 months now, and it's a great product. I was considering the cheaper (and newer) Zoom H1, but went with the Zoom H2 because it can work as a USB microphone on my computer - great for podcasting. I sometime record meetings/lectures and either use this standalone or pair it with a wireless microphone, getting great results either way. The microphones built into this H2 are very high quality, and much better than any other handheld recorder I've seen/used.
customer_reviews.author: Anon E. Moss

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, a few issues.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Good sound quality -Excellent value -Menu is easy to navigate -Good number of recording options -Comes with a 512MB SD card, a stand, a handle that screws into the bottom to make it into a interview mic, a little pouch, and a foam wind guard Cons: -Prone to handling noise -Build quality feels cheap - all plastic except for the mic enclosure -A little slow to turn on (roughly 2 or 3 sec before you can begin recording) -Playing back files on the device is cumbersome I've had the mic for a little less than a month but I've enjoyed the quality of the files it produces. For the price, you can't really beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Alright Okay

customer_reviews.title: Clear sound, lots of features, tricky interface
customer_reviews.text: H2 makes crisp recordings in most situations, whether via mic or line input. The 2 onboard mics provide for several patterns, back rejection, mono, etc. Added 8 GB card provides appx. 100 hours of continuous recording in WAV format. Numerous file transcoding options onboard (e.g., WAV to MP3). Interface is a bit tricky, takes some focus to remember the sequence, pluss it is small, hard to read. But hey, for the price, it delivers superbly on the core element - great recorded audio.
customer_reviews.author: ArtOfSilence

customer_reviews.title: poorly housed in cheap plastic-- very well made inside.
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised to be reviewing this as positively as I am -- Disclosure -- I have had this one month -- I cannot comment on how durable it is. The outside is junk. The little door for the SD card broke straightaway. There are takeout food containers made of higher quality molded plastic. However, the thing works beautifully, and the functions are great. If the tradeoff for the price is the shell, then I think it is great to be able to get a tool like this for as cheap as it is. My review would change if the inside is as poorly made -- but so far, it seems that it is good, and I hope it does last.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Very messy
customer_reviews.text: I am happy that my recorder came in but at the same time I am not happy because it came with dead batteries, no AC adapter, a bubble wrap with nothing inside, an amazon prime plastic bag that was cut open and had nothing inside. It would of been nice if it was more organized and actually had everything.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: superb value, surprisingly good sound
customer_reviews.text: This is really a terrific little unit. Switch it on, give it a few seconds to boot up, and you are ready to record in stereo. The recording quality is really astonishly good for the price point - clear and crisp, excellent stereo imaging. I would not say it's studio quality by any means, but it is more than sufficient for recording a gig, sketching ideas, or using as an audio input source for a webcast, webcam, etc. The USB interface is straightforward for both this latter purpose and for pulling recorded material onto computer. In all, an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: zenpicker

customer_reviews.title: Records like almost professional .
customer_reviews.text: The sound is true. Others will want to go buy one when they hear the quality of a recording. The unit sells itself. This is the H2 and has more bells and whistles than the H2N, although the H2N is less expensive. Due to lugging it around someone broke it. I suggest getting a case for it, even silicone if you have nothing else. Can't beat the quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Fundmntl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, handy recorder
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I plug it into my sound board or just use the microphones. It makes excellent recordings everytime. If you use this, make sure you don't plug your external input into the mic socket. They look the same (but are marked appropriately) and I have mixed them up with poor results. Also, I find that the time remaining is hard to read. This reflects on my need for reading glasses more than anything else.... I highly highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Stephen  Pomerantz

customer_reviews.title: zoom h2 recorder
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing llittle recorder. Easy to use and set up. The Surround recording capability is awesome. I used it to record a few songs with my Tuesday night jam session with three other guitar players. We used three accoustic guitars and an electric bass guitar. We sat in a circle with the H2 in the middle. It picked up each instrument and the 2 voices beautifully. Actually, its hard for me to believe that something so small could do that. A great recorder for live recording the jam sessions. We won't be without it!!
customer_reviews.author: dirtypierre

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Consumer Field Recorder
customer_reviews.text: So great. Couldn't recommend it more for those who are interested in recording audio from whatever environment they're in. I've owned my H2 for over a year, and have been able to capture many high-quality recordings. The four microphones provide lots of flexibility, the controls are intuitive and easy, the drag-and-drop USB interface is painless, the results are great, and all from a surprisingly portable, pocket-sized device. I've used several H2 recordings in my Cubase creations. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Starcadia

customer_reviews.title: H2 Portable Stereo Recorder
customer_reviews.text: I'm only using a few of the features of this little recorder, but I'm loving it. It is easy to setup and it has given me very faithful copies of my audio streams. There may be a slight difference in the sensitivity between right and left channels, maybe as much as 2 dB. Maybe it is caused my me not aligning the recorder properly to my position, but I can balance it easily with my laptop editing program. I love the compactness of the Zoom H2 and the ability to use SDHC cards.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Zoom boosts their rep.
customer_reviews.text: Handy. This is the future. A pocket recorder that will do 24-bit recording as stereo or 16-bit as 4-way. The mics are adequate and the processing speed is suprising. Runs on 2 AA batteries and has line in and out features with soft gain controls. I use this for mastering digitally after mixing down in the analog domain. SD card limit provides hours of recording and is solid for field sampling. Transfer is fast and drivers are easy to use. The only 2 drawbacks are the button/controls/layout of the settings, and the built-in compressor/limiter...this is useless for anything but spoken podcasts....sounds awful with music. Just pre-compress/limit it and you'll be okay. This is still great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew G. Whitelaw

customer_reviews.title: Great field or music jam recorder
customer_reviews.text: I will not bother you with detailed descriptions of what is good about this recorder; you can find that information in many other reviews. What I will say is this: For its price, no other digital recorder can measure up to this great little recorder. If you want a recorder that is portable, good on batteries, produces recordings with great fidelity, is extremely versatile, and is affordable, look no further than the Zoom H2. Buy it, you'll like it!!!
customer_reviews.author: K. J. Skipper

customer_reviews.title: Listen to Quality Here
customer_reviews.text: If search YouTube for "Randy Dukes it ain't easy being me" you will see this on the tractor by his feet picking up his guitar and voice. I recorded all of his videos using this for audio. The sound this little gadget covers is phenomenal. Save the windscreen
customer_reviews.author: James Douglas Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations - a real gem!
customer_reviews.text: Beyond expectations! Very good audio quality from the built in microphones. Have recorded 4 channel and mixed it down to two with very good results. Totally pleased and amazed with this studio in a shaver (it resembles an electric shaver, but sounds like an Otari 5050B at 15IPS with Dolby SR and a couple of AKG microphones going through good preamps - I.E. Very good indeed)
customer_reviews.author: Peter Swanson

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: There are so many reviews of this little jewel, I won't bother going into details but it's everything I could have hoped for and more. The sound quality is amazing and it's very easy to use. I'm using it for so many things including a music player for my truck. I take it everywhere and it has never let me down. I had to get my own carrying case but for the quality versus price and accessories that ARE included, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Jennings

customer_reviews.title: H2 review
customer_reviews.text: The H2 is not as intuitive and easy to use as described in the manufacture's literature. You have to get the devise set up at the right place before you can just "push the button and record." Then, there is the same problem in play back and delete. The H2 does not have a speaker so the ear plugs have to be plugged in or it has to go through some other devise in order to hear what you've recorded. One of the biggest problems with it is the very small screen. It is actually better to use a magnifying glass to read it. Maybe I'll get used to it after more use.
customer_reviews.author: James Humphrey III

customer_reviews.title: Great recorder, rugged, and the best buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the H2 for over a year now, and I will say this thing is the best bang for your buck. I bought this one for a friend. It is great for field recordings or recording concerts. Or rehearsals. Or song ideas while you are on the road. Or whatever. It can handle a huge amount of sound pressure without overloading and is very easy to use. Rugged, affordable, and the sound quality is grade A. The built-in dynamic microphones do the job nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wachunas

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a Saxophonist on GigMasters.com "[...]" And I needed something to record and download my music samples onto my website. The Portable recorder did just that!!! Very easy to use! Will even convert (.wav) files to (.mp3) in a matter of minutes. The only down fall is I wish it recorded oneself while a music player was connected directly into it. The portable microphone becomes disconnected once something is connected into the recorder. It will however, record the music that is coming into it. Another down fall is that the display screen is too small in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Knight06gold

customer_reviews.title: Zoom H2
customer_reviews.text: I love this little recorder. It does exactly what I wanted it to do. I bought the Zoom to record song ideas and to practice new material. It's very easy to use and easy to transfer music to your computer. The sound quality is very clean and better than what I expected from a handheld recorder. I haven't used it with recording software yet but am told you can tweak anything you've recorded. It's a great tool for anyone trying to write new material or to record practices, gigs etc. It's worth the money spent and I would recommend it highly if you're looking for a simple, easy to use handheld recorder.
customer_reviews.author: D. Preli

customer_reviews.title: The Go-To Audio Recorder You Need!
customer_reviews.text: The Handy Zoom H-2 has all the features you need to capture audio for your projects. It is compatible with many computer operating systems. Ingesting audio clips from the recorder to your computer is very easy. Working with the files is easy, too. The menu system is a *little* intricate, but once you get the hang of it, you can find what you want quickly. If you're looking to do audio projects, this is the versatile and affordable recorder you want!
customer_reviews.author: K. Loebrich

customer_reviews.title: Great recorder at this price point
customer_reviews.text: I have now used the H2 recorder for several podcasts. The sound is excellent and it picks up the speaker from a good distance away. Use the included handle for a portable microphone to do interview type podcasts. It works great. If the sound turns out to be a little bit too low, just run it through the free Audacity software and "amplify" it. With the 8 gig SD card it can record for HOURS!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Lalumia

customer_reviews.title: Zoom H2 Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This little thing does everything promised beautifully, and the fidelity is amazing. For so many options I found the menus just fine. If you don't have analog-to-digital interface software on your computer, just save an LP or casette to the H2 and download it as a complete file later. There are ways. . . . But be advised: as it says, it won't allow overdubbing, or mixing direct line and mic inputs. It even comes with a mic stand adaptor!
customer_reviews.author: pasgran2

customer_reviews.title: Zoom buyer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Zoom H2 Handy Portable Stereo Recorder for next seminar's classes. I won't be back to school until Fall, but in the meantime I've been trying out the recorder in different venues/media, outside recording whatever sounds are made, inside recording from the TV; wherever I was, the Zoom was picking up sound so well that when played back it you didn't know if it was the recorder or the actual subject being heard. I look forward to recording classes so I can have access to a source other than the book.
customer_reviews.author: joyce drummond

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gizmo
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I use it to record my son's concerts. Formerly I would take the audio track from a HDD camcorder. The H2 is far superior to that method, in terms of quality and ease of use. Get a 4GB card so you can record uncompressed -- which you'll want to do if you plan on any post-processing. I got an Ultra II card because I was concerned about getting drops from write latency. It did the trick but I'm not sure if a cheaper card would also have sufficed.
customer_reviews.author: Xerxes

customer_reviews.title: H2 Zoom review
customer_reviews.text: This works just as I had hoped. Great sound and downloads fine onto my Mac (TIger 10.4). Wish the battery lasted a little longer but it comes with a 120v power plug. Sure, build quality may not be as strong as you would like, but I use this maybe once a week and I bought a camera case (Swissgear Medium @ Best Buy) that fits it perfectly so I think it will last a very long time.I'm recording jams and rehearsals mostly and the mic options are great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best mobile recording device yet!
customer_reviews.text: I used to own an M-Audio Microtrack and switched to the H2 after the lithium battery in the Microtrack died. The H2 uses AA batteries which is a godsend - just swap in rechargeable AAs and you have perpetual recording time as long as the battery pile lasts. Sound quality is terrific - play with the various forms of gain control to get the best sound for your voice, as it does take some experimenting. For those who say it's not great with external mics, I use a Giant Squid cardioid lavalier mic and it's just fine - just make sure Plug In Power is turned on or the mic will indeed not pick up much of anything.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Penn

customer_reviews.title: Get the new H2n instead
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the H2 quite some time ago and have been generally pleased. The only problem I've experienced has been what some others have also had: the easily broken hinge for the SD card slot cover. But if you're reading these reviews now (after mid 2011), know that the updated Zoom H2n is available. The most important improvements I see are: The recording level control is now a knob (similar to the Sony PCM-M10, which I also recommend). The microphones are improved and you are now offered mid-side recording! And the unit looks better in black. See a full product description for more details.
customer_reviews.author: Keen Observer

customer_reviews.title: Good product, now updated
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for several years. It has worked flawlessly. It has done a pretty good job with many recordings, especially in the field. Zoom has now upgraded this unit and has other models on the market that are superior. At the time this first came out it was one of the best on the market in its price class.
customer_reviews.author: Billy The Kid

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality - too hard to convert
customer_reviews.text: I may be a goofus, but I tried this on a live recording and it did very well. However, the micro-mini jacks, which tend to promote noise, and the fact that you just can't hit replay and listen, you need other software (not mentioned prior to sale) gives this a lower mark than it could have. It is simply a twin condenser mic combo that records digitally to a format not recognized by computers.
customer_reviews.author: magicman

customer_reviews.title: This is my go-to recorder when I need good clean audio and I don't have time to set up anything.
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to recorder when I need good clean audio and I don't have time to set up anything. Just press and go. I've used it to record music, sound effects, do voiceovers, you name it. Pull the card, put it in a card reader, transfer the tracks to the computer and you're done. Great unit.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Lang

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE my Zoom!
customer_reviews.text: I am a flute student and purchased the Zoom for recording my flute instructor's interpretations of pieces I am working on. I must say, it was like buying a chain saw to cut a loaf of bread! This baby records on 4-channels in stereo and does so in .mp3 or .wav format. It is really an off-the-chain recorder that packs a lot of punch for the money. You won't be sorry you bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Asradel

customer_reviews.title: SAMSON H2 is Handy & High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something that could deliver the quality, clarity, and fidelity of recording that just is not possible with microphones hooked to a PC or telephone voicemail options. This device has surely delivered beyond my expectations. If fact, the day that it was received, my brothers birthday party was happening - with 6 hours of live performances in his home, including the original COASTERS group. I recorded all of those hours with great fidelity on just the 1GB chip that was included. Everything played back with sound that appeared to be identical to what I was hearing in the room where the performing was going on.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Stansbury

customer_reviews.title: Excellent field recorder
customer_reviews.text: I'm a musician and use this to record rehearsals. It is very simple to use and provides outstanding quality once you get a feel for which settings work best in which situations. A band mate has a Zoom H2 and he is constantly fiddling with it while this thing is completely intuitive. A real bargain and I like that it doesn't have a bunch of guitar effects and other junk to complicate things.
customer_reviews.author: AlanA

customer_reviews.title: Da Wei's Review of Zoom H2
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Build quality could be more solid but price was right. I am very pleased with it. Two tips - if upgrading to 1.80 and using an Apple, be sure the file name in the download doesn't change when unzipped. Also, be sure the usb plug to the unit is solidly pushed in and connected when using as a storage device attached to a Mac. I had to rename the unzipped downloaded file to get the firmware upgrade to work on my minimac.
customer_reviews.author: Da Wei

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!!!
customer_reviews.text: First recording was a band practice ... 18-players including horns, drums, piano and accordian. Used the 360 degree 2-track setting. WOW, results are amazing. Very easy to use menu and controls, MP3 conversion was a snap. Am really looking forward to using more of the features, e.g. using it as a microphone for Podcast recording on my computer. Definitely get yourself a high capacity card, 4+ Gigs at least. A lot of recording devise for the money. Watch out Tascam.
customer_reviews.author: J. Abramson

customer_reviews.title: Astounding quality of recordings.
customer_reviews.text: Man, I love this recorder. It looks like a cheapie from outside but its record quality is just amazing! Yeah I know it is an old hardware, doesn't support SDHC cards, the front panel keyboard is like ZX Spectrum one, switches are terrible. But under the good there is a great engine, sensitive microphone, great encoding quality. I love to listen what I recorded. I don't know about other Zoom products, but this one is just the winner!
customer_reviews.author: Jurek Kedra

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Used it for several years while recording secretary for lineal based organization.Worked fine. The only problem is that the screen is small,and a mistake is possible. But the machine works fine.
customer_reviews.author: happy consumer

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. The blister buttons are unintuitive, but once you figure it out its fine. The H1 is awesome too.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Verde

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with the sound quality on this and it is fairly easy to use - though you should plan to read the manual once. With a 4 GB SD card, you can store a lot of quality audio. Microphone pickup is very good. I wish it had a small internal speaker for playback - you have to use the earphones to listen to recordings, but this has been my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Spearman

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight. It almost scares me how light this little device is. The recording quality is superb. Seriously. If you use this to record sound, you better make the perfect sound, because this Handy Recorder will pick up every little imperfection. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Could not believe the recording Quality
customer_reviews.text: I can not believe the clarity and accurate reproduction. It is far superior than my PC with its ugraded Creative Labs sound card. It is loaded with features I will not use such as a metronone and chromatic tuner. It enables some editing of the recording. You can record in the MP3 or WAV formats. I could not believe the quality and features at the price.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Tomberg

customer_reviews.title: Is Awesome for the Studio
customer_reviews.text: The device is great. I operate a small record-label recording studio and the Handy Recorder H2 is really an asset. The line in is great for all types of studio recording. TIP: I found if a level is slightly to high such as a guitar effect overdrive/gain that splittin the input signal into a pair of headphones reduces the Decibles enough to get a clean -6 recording. The H2 has a great "normalizer" except 0DB is the only setting I could find. Feild recording is great, the three microphone-gain setting work perfectly. The H2 organizes files really well, and also the SD gigabyte card tranfers to the laptop successfully every time. A great recording device all-the-way-around.
customer_reviews.author: LEPROCY

customer_reviews.title: Super sound quality but don't forget your headphones
customer_reviews.text: I now use my Zoom instead of a dictaphone in my work as a journalist after having it recommended to me by some professional sound engineers. Positives: broadcast quality sound, high portability (it's the size and shape of an old electric razor) and incredible sensitivity. Negatives: eats batteries voraciously, lack of even a rudimentary speaker for immediate playback (forgot headphones and it is useless). Menus are a bit fiddly. But overall it is a heck of a piece of kit for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Collier

customer_reviews.title: Zoom H2 recorder
customer_reviews.text: This is great machine. Sensitive and small size. It records well, can convert files to MP3 (but takes some time), can record stereo or four channels. Microphone is sensitive, quality is good. Provided wind cap is tight, but works well.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Paula

customer_reviews.title: To H2 or not to H2
customer_reviews.text: I bought the H2 as a secondary recording device for use with my Panasonic GH2DSLR. To get better sound quality than the cameras onboard microphone allows, one can record dual sound with the Zoom H2 and synchronise this sound to the picture later. For this the H2 is perfectly capable, recording superlative sound and for the price it is an absolute steal. I have also used it to record off air radio and it works really well. For a super sonic device you really can't go wrong with the H2.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Squires

customer_reviews.title: A marvel of technology
customer_reviews.text: This product offers ASTOUNDING audio quality. I use it routinely to capture nature recordings, often with insane dynamic range. This recorder does not disappoint. You can even make 5.1 surround recordings with some inexpensive software. The screen is rather small, but this is to be expected given the overall size of the device.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this for anyone interested in recording ideas or song ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about three years ago and still use it regularly. I recommend this for anyone interested in recording ideas or song melodies. Simple and clear file options and transfers well to Garageband or whatever recording software you use.
customer_reviews.author: Beelzebub666

customer_reviews.title: GET IT!
customer_reviews.text: I was first shown this recorder by a professor at my school of music. It's honestly the best portable recorder you can get for the price. I've used it to record my own tuba playing. The sound quality is great even in the low playing. I've used it for recording brass quintets and quartets and the sound quality is amazing in all registers and volumes. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable range and quality. Unbeatable at price! or ...
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable range and quality. Unbeatable at price! or 100 more. Tricky navigation to settings, but once you dial it in it can record at 44/96. You tell me. Even has quad mode , 4 discrete mics!
customer_reviews.author: Rj Miller

customer_reviews.title: Phenominal
customer_reviews.text: I use the H2 to record my band's practice sessions and so far it is one fine piece of equipment. Easy to operate and the sound quality just blew us away. I am using Audacity ( shareware) to tweak the results a bit and the end result is fabulous. I just last night recorded in 4 channel and those results were the best yet. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: William Bray

customer_reviews.title: Great Recorder
customer_reviews.text: The Zoom H2 is a dream come true. I've recorded several live shows with it as well as some in-home recording. THe quality is unbelievable. Definitely demo worthy. I even recorded one loud rock & roll show where I could barely make out the vocals. The Zoom recorded everything clearly. I could hear the vocals better on the Zoom than at the show!
customer_reviews.author: Brian R. Straub

customer_reviews.title: Lot of features in a small package at the right price
customer_reviews.text: I use the Zoom H2 to record pipe organs. This type of recording demands a very wide frequency range, and the ability to record the ambience of the room. Using the four channel surround mode fits this purpose. The controls and display are very intuitive. The ability to update the firmware is a big plus. The only two suggestions I have are that the manufacture illuminate the controls on future models, and provide internal microphone specifications.
customer_reviews.author: Neal R. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Finally I have a recorder for live band recordings!
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted a high fidelity recorder that can handle live band recordings. This one does the trick. Since our band is pretty loud, I set the sensitivity to low, and it sounds great. I'm recording in MP3 format, and start and stop the recorder after each song. That way I get separate MP3's for each song. I like that you can turn on front and back mics separately, and I replaced the 512M SD card that came with it with a 4G card for 59 hours of recording capacity at the MP3 quality level that I selected. Very happy with how it's working.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for recording my podcast. It has more features than I ever needed. Most of the editing features are better done on a computer using editing software since the H2 controls are limited to a few buttons and a rudimentary LCD display, but the recording quality is excellent. It pays to carefully read the manual to get the most out of it. You can upgrade the memory card to higher capacity...I use 8GB and can store 12 hours of mono recording. This fits my need for producing an audio book and the portability lets me record lectures and meetings easily.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Brown

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great audio quality
customer_reviews.text: I was apprehensive about buying the H2 because of reviews that said the screen was too small and the menu drill down was not user friendly. I found that both the screen and menu are efficient and effective. I do not regret my decision to buy in any way, quite the opposite. I love the H2 and my friends were jealous when they saw it. The H2 produced better quality than I expected and the default settings for speech, vocals, and other types of audio worked great right out of the box. It even included a 1Gb card instead of the 512Mb card advertised. It has every necessary accessory included unlike many other competitive products.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Zoom H2 Portable Recorder
customer_reviews.text: This item was recommended by a podcasting friend who used it for an interview with us. It was so simple and the sound was great. I had to have one. I was impressed with the ease of use once I figured out which buttons do what. I will be experimenting with the different settings. The instruction book is easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Jim G.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little handy recorder
customer_reviews.text: I use this as an audio interface. The microphone's quality is great. And it's very comfortable to use. Obviously, it doesn't sound as good as professional studio, but with a little bit of work in DAW software (I use cool edit), it produces a satisfying sound. For those of you who would like to listen to what Zoom H2 sounds like, I have posted a song on here: [...]
customer_reviews.author: T K

customer_reviews.title: Super Stereo Recorder
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product in my possession for over two months and I have recored my wife's church choir and two of my own bands, and I must say that this recorder is by far worth the money. When I down load the wav files into my computer for editing and playback the sound quility is second to none. My only gripe is that the display screen is too small to read and the control buttons are also too small. Zoom could have done better if they fitted the unit with rasied buttons instead of the flat panel. Other than that it is a first class gem.
customer_reviews.author: B. E. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I got this product after reading a review by Michael Hyatt. I am doing more presentations, and I want to record them for future review and have an archive. Its small and portable and easy to use. The included media card facilitates and easy transfer of data. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Anthold

customer_reviews.text: This little thing is a singer's best friend... especially if you suck. You won't for very long once you get one of these and hear yourself clearly. I'm not a tech geek so I haven't even begun to explore all the other things it's capable of, but for my purposes this electronic marvel was a Godsend.

I didn't have time to read the directions in detail so I didn't know how to set it up using the output from my mixer; I used the mic stand adapter and hit the record button. WOW is an understatement to describe the recording I got. Unfortunately it also recorded the audience noise so I now know to use the "Line Input" & my mixer output. If you need a great and fool-proof recorder buy this guy.

customer_reviews.title: awesome gadget. works as advertised. i recommend it.

If you are serious about sound, this is the device you have been seeking!

Something like this would have been on my wish list forever because i really wanted the Sony.This has been a lot of fun i have made a lot of great recordings just make sure you have reading glass while you use it.

customer_reviews.title: Surprise packet
customer_reviews.text: I never imagined some gadget can be so effective in recording yet so small. My drum teacher suggested me this gadget, as I wanted to critically review how I played something. Whoever listened to my recording was impressed with the quality instantly. You can make out each instrument separately. I would rate it as an essential accessory for any music student, at least in beginning. I would love to have a remote which can switch recording on and off from a distance while I am starting and finished playing.

The audio quality is great, it's just not very convenient to use. It also eats up batteries really fast for something with no moving parts and a tiny LCD (maybe 6 hours of recording and they have to be replaced).

customer_reviews.title: Perfect recording unit!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this years ago, its still working perfectly! Perfect for concerts and outdoor events, high quality recordings!

customer_reviews.text: 10 years of use and still working. Great sound recorder device.

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy! For a Muscian.
customer_reviews.text: Son (Trumpet Player)uses at college and he records his music concerts. Really good buy. He uses for his practices too.

customer_reviews.text: This device produces recordings of very nice quality. I use it to record my violin music for my students to play along and it works great. product_meta.title: Zoom H2 Handy Portable Stereo Recorder
product_meta.description:
The Zoom H2 stands alone in an increasingly crowded field of handheld portable digital recorders. Its 4 onboard microphones are an industry first! With easy to navigate controls and sound quality that rivals units costing much more, the Zoom H2 Handy Recorder is an extremely capable performer capturing music, spoken word, ambient sounds from the field and anything that makes a sound. This is the perfect portable digital recorder for capturing meetings, music, or any other sound recording where you need full 360 degree coverage.Operation is easy and intuitive. One button push and youre instantly recording! The Auto Start and Auto Gain functions help ensure that youre recording levels are optimized and sound is at its fullest resolution without distortion. The 360 degree coverage of the Zoom H2 four microphone configuration makes it easy to record your meeting (place it in the middle of a conference table) or your band or string quartet and pick up ever word and every note with crystal clarity and full range sound.The H2 records to a 1GB SD media card (included) and can accommodate up to a 32GB card allowing 24 hours of recording time @ 16-bit/44.1kHz CD quality in industry standard WAV format. You can also record at 128kbps MP3 affording 280 hours of stereo recording time.With a 360 W-X/Y microphone configuration as well as optional 90 (front of the unit) and 120 (rear) the flexibility for capturing sounds from multi-directions results in amazing stereo imaging. Record at a 96K/24 bit rate will allow you to convert your recordings to 5.1 surround, but straight ahead stereo recording is just as easy!You can monitor through the included earbuds or use the 1/8 stereo jack output for hookup to your studio monitors or home stereo. Connect the Zoom H1 to a computer via the built-in USB port (USB cable included) and easily transfer your files for further editing, sweetening and sharing. The USB port also makes it possible to use the H2 as a USB microphone for direct ...

AMAZON.COM
It's a simple idea: provide brilliant stereo recording in an easy-to-use, ultra-portable device. Now everyone can record pristine audio in an infinite variety of applications. From seminars and conferences, to electronic news gathering (ENG) and podcasting, to musical performances, songwriting sessions and rehearsals, the H2 provides amazing recording quality. And no matter what kind of music you perform or the instrument you play, the H2 can effortlessly record it in high-quality stereo. 

 Why Four Mics are Better Than Two



90° Pattern
Record from the front at 90° 
120° Pattern
Record from the front at 120° The H2 is the only portable recorder with 4 mic capsules on-board for 360° recording. With 4 mic capsules in a W-X/Y configuration, the audio is decoded instantly, bringing these four signals together for unparalleled stereo imaging. 

 But the H2 doesn't stop there. For maximum flexibility, you can record from the front of the H2 in a 90° pickup pattern or the rear of the H2 in a 120° pickup pattern at up to 96 kHz/24-bit resolution as a WAV file, or as an MP3 file at bitrates up to 320 kbps. Additionally, you can record in a 360° pickup pattern at up to 48kHz/24-bit resolution which will allow you to convert your recordings to 5.1 Surround. 

 Push a Button...
That's all it takes to start recording! The H2 is a remarkably robust device that is incredibly easy to use. One button recording, gain controls on the side and an intuitive user interface mean you can always capture the moment. Set your levels, push record and go. It's that simple. Or use the Auto Start and Auto Gain Control functions to ensure complete capture at the right level. And if you need to fine-tune your levels on the fly, we made it easy with gain control buttons on the front panel. 

 Play it Back!
Play your recordings on your home audio system with its 1/8" stereo output or listen to your masterpiece with headphones. Or, use the H2's USB interface to move your recordings to your Mac or PC to listen, edit and share. 

 The H2 records on Secure Digital (SD) media and a 512MB SD card is included. The unit can accommodate up to a 16GB SD card, allowing up to 24 hours of total recording time using the 16-bit/44.1kHz WAV format. At 128kbps MP3, you get an amazing 280 hours of stereo recording. Store your recordings on a PC or Mac with its USB 2.0 interface. And you can use its time stamping function for reference during production. Or use the H2 as a USB Mic for recording directly to a computer. 

 What's Life Without Accessories?
The H2 comes with earbuds, 1/8 inch stereo to RCA cable, mic clip adapter, tripod stand, USB cable, AC adapter and a 512MB SD card. 

 Ultimate Convenience
The H2 weighs 4 ounces and fits in your pocket for the ultimate in portability and convenience. Two standard alkaline AA batteries will give you 4 hours of continuous operation and a backlit display means it's always easy to use in any situation. 

 Enjoy Your Brilliance
Brilliant stereo recording in a convenient, user-friendly package means there's never been an easier way to record high quality audio. The H2 gives everyone the power to record anything and share it with anyone, anywhere. You'll be amazed by your sound. 

 Features: 

 * W-XY mic patterns with 4 mic capsules and signal processing allows Front 90° cardioid, Rear 120° cardioid and 360° polar patterns 
 * Built-in USB 2.0 interface 
 * Records in WAV 96kHz/48kHz/44.1kHz at 16-bit or 24-bit, MP3 to 320kbps and Variable Bit Rate (VBR) data formats 
 * Time Stamp and Track Marker functions in Broadcast WAV Format (BWF) 
 * 512MB SD memory card included 
 * Accommodates up to 16GB SD memory cards 
 * Auto Gain Control (AGC) for pristine recordings 
 * Auto Start function means you're always ready to record 
 * Low-cut filter eliminates wind noise 
 * On-board chromatic Guitar/Bass tuner 



 H2 Handy Recorder Features at a Glance


The H2 Handy Recorder brings the ultimate in functionality and versatility to portable digital recording. A clear, backlit display features recording levels, time code, file name and remaining battery life. LEDs indicate Front, Rear, 2 Channel or 4 Channel modes and the recording angle: 90°, 120° or 360°. An Active Mic LED is on the front and back of the H2. Transport controls include one button recording, playback and pause, fast forward and rewind. Use the Menu key to enter the control menu and the cursor keys to navigate through the feature sets. 

 Within the menu, set recording parameters such as direction and polar pattern, activate the Auto Start function and set file format. And you'll find additional settings like Auto Gain Control to make sure your recordings are always pristine. And you can fine-tune your levels on the fly with the Record Level buttons on the front. 

 

On the left side of the H2 is a 1/8" Phone/Line Output for monitoring and playback. Playback Volume, Power On and the AC power are located here as well. 

 On the right side of the H2, you can plug in a powered 1/8" external stereo mic. Setting levels is easy with a Mic Gain slider for Low/Medium/High gain. You can also digitize analog recordings with the 1/8" Line In. 

 Use the USB 2.0 Interface to move your files to a PC or Mac for storage, editing and playback. The time stamp function is great for reference during production. And you can even use the H2 as a USB mic and record directly to your favorite digital audio software. 

 For brilliant stereo recording, and plenty of extras, there's never been a simpler or more functional solution than the H2 Handy Recorder from Zoom. 

 Please note: The Zoom H2 will not mount as a USB Drive on MAC OS X 10.5.0 Leopard unless you update to H2 Firmware version 1.2 or higher.
